intro: Carduus benedictus, commonly known as blessed thistle, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features upright, hairy stems and deeply lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically purple to reddish in color and bloom in the summer months. Blessed thistle is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in herbal remedies.
